description: Monitor real-time changes in weather and AQI, comparing them with local satisfaction and AI driven predictions.

panels.description:
The AQI in Islamabad, Pakistan. 
Source: https://api.waqi.info/

targets.query:
from(bucket: "islamabadAQI")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "AQI")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "Temperature")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "_value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "raw")

panels.title: Karachi - Predicted Satisfaction

panels.description:
The average of all local views of weather of air quality in Islamabad, Pakistan.

This data is entirely subjective and was obtained by asking users the question, "What does the air quality feel like in your area? A higher score indicates better air quality"
and,
"What does the weather feel like in your area? A higher score indicates better weather conditions"

targets.query:
means = from(bucket: "islamabadFeelsLike")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) =>
       (r._measurement == "AirQuality" and (r._field == "_value")) or
       (r._measurement == "Weather" and (r._field == "_value"))
     )
  |> group(columns: ["_measurement"])   // compute mean per measurement
  |> mean()
  |> keep(columns: ["_measurement", "_value"]) // keep only what we need

// create point at range start
means_start = means
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with _time: v.timeRangeStart }))

// create point at range stop
means_stop = means
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with _time: v.timeRangeStop }))

// combine both points so each measurement has two points (start + stop)
union(tables: [means_start, means_stop])
  |> sort(columns: ["_time"])
  |> group(columns: ["_measurement"])

period = 30m     // how wide each window is (more width = smoother)
every  = 1m     // how often we emit a window (smaller = denser / smoother)

from(bucket: "islamabadFeelsLike")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) =>
       (r._measurement == "AirQuality" and r._field == "_value") or
       (r._measurement == "Weather"    and r._field == "_value")
     )
  |> group(columns: ["_measurement"])        // compute separately per measurement
  |> window(every: every, period: period, createEmpty: false) 
  |> mean()                                 // mean over each sliding window
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with _time: r._stop })) // put the point at window end (or use _start)
  |> group(columns: ["_measurement"])        // re-group for plotting if needed
  |> yield(name: "sliding_time_window_mean")

panels.title: Karachi - Average Local Satisfaction

panels.description:
A view of how satisfied locals are of the local conditions in Islamabad, Pakistan.

This data is entirely subjective and was obtained by asking users the question, "What does the air quality feel like in your area? A higher score indicates better air quality"
and,
"What does the weather feel like in your area? A higher score indicates better weather conditions"
